bibl.title: Letter from Vice-Governor General to the Minister of the Colonies

div1.p: Local Government 5th Direction Justice No. 1427 Remember in the answer the number, the date and the number of the Direction Response of no of Don Gle Don Don 2 Annexes Subject: By the way of the Vice-Consul General of the United States of America's trip in the Mayumbe
Minster of Colonies Direction The 2 Division Direction No of order 1119 Entered the 8-8-1911
Minister of Colonies General No 9181 2 August 1911

I'm honored to inform you under this original envelope, a letter that I addressed on the 26th of last june, Mr. Jacques, ex-lieutenant of the Independant State of the Congo, at present a plantation owner in the Mayumbe, regarding the facts that happened in this region, facts that would make Mr. Vice- Consul General of the United States of America of Boma guilty.

At first glance the important accuasation by Mr. Jacques is somewhat surprising, the Vice-Consul General of the United States of America, incidentally much like his Italian and English colleagues, maintains a polite relationship with the local government.
Nevertheless I advise a discrete but meticulous investigation with the hope of establishing the justification for the allegations in question.
I will not fail to keep you informed of the results of this investigation.
I attached a copy of my response to date to this letter for Mr Jacques.
Mr. Minister of the Brussels Colonies.-
